channel.title: CiTR -- Parts Unknown
channel.description: Parts Unknown, an indie pop show hat has been on Mondays on CiTR from 1pm to 3pm since 1999, is like a marshmallow sandwich: soft and sweet and best enjoyed when poked with a stick and held close to a fire.
channel.itunes:summary: Parts Unknown, an indie pop show hat has been on Mondays on CiTR from 1pm to 3pm since 1999, is like a marshmallow sandwich: soft and sweet and best enjoyed when poked with a stick and held close to a fire.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Jan-2009
item.description: Exuma to begin, then some news about the Emergency room and rumoured break up of yet another great band in Vancouver. You say sucky city, yes? I say Resiliant Mother Fuckers in this city. Burn down our venues! We will make new ones! You cannot kill the fight in us Vancouverites, city hall. Just the weak ones putter off to Montreal (Nut Brown, TRAITOR!!!) It just makes us more focussed and more creative. Sooner or later, one of us will win the lottery, and we can do the venue thing legit, but until then............................
item.itunes:subtitle: good show I think,,,,,,,

item.title: Robert Hamon
item.description: Robert has been bugging me get on the program forever. He liked the show. He made me some mix CD's. Then I asked him to host for the hour. He has got great taste. That song "that's why darkies are born" is messed up!! That Captain Beefheart song is awesome as well. He has got a great radio voice. Far better then mine. cheers.
item.itunes:subtitle: braving the snow to host

item.title: Broadcast on 29-Dec-2008
item.description: my lady Alison and our friends from the Apollo Ghosts joined me for a year end wrap up show. My apologies to Bonnie Billy for talking all over his tune. tunes by Sic Alps, Women (yes Luke, you convinced me) The Frames, Katie Stelmanis and the Lovely Sajia Kabir illuminate the Parts Unknown 2008 Best Of show. see you in 2009 everybody!!
item.itunes:subtitle: year end show!!

item.title: The FUN 100 reunion annoucement
item.description: A long shot...actually...this was just a reason to get Ryan on my show. His music taste is wonderful. I hope Vancouver doesn't win. The way Fun 100 went out was the way everyone in a band wants to go out.....in a blaze of glory you can see a mile away. Next week, I will have my best of show!! take care cnris
item.itunes:subtitle: with the hope that the Canucks will win a Stanley Cup for 2009

item.title: Broadcast on 15-Dec-2008
item.description: played a They Shoot Horses song! I was in the band. The band broke up this year. I'm sure Bryce has played Smugglers on his show. No? Take care.
item.itunes:subtitle: I was feeling nostalgic. Forgive me!

item.title: Robert is going to hate me!
item.description: This fellow was supposed to come to CiTR tomorrow with a mix CD for me but I had to record yesterday. Good Show though I think take care
item.itunes:subtitle: I hope I can get to him in time

item.title: cannot have a fund drive without "U"
item.description: a fine balance. I've never listened to CiTR more than during this fund drive. All Awesome in your Ears....two young folks having an great ol time on the air. Duncan's Donuts. Exquisite. Ground Control. Inspired. Enjoy the show, my friends.
item.itunes:subtitle: raindrop prelude for my sweetie.

item.title: Live yes Live
item.description: Good show. Finally got to play the song by David Bowie when he sings in German. So good. What a scrapper. Also. Some sic alps, Jan Terri, Stolen Minks, some Loup Garou by LALA, a great Big Star song, a passable Cure cover and many other great gems. Enjoy!

item.title: Broadcast on 30-Jun-2008
item.description: more devastating then the last game. Luke destroyed me at on-air Rock trivia. I know his system, but I have no defence against his knowledge about the Beatles. He kept landing on that "you pick a topic" square and he kept going to the bloody Beatles. It was horrible. To be fair to myself, all he has to do answer question. I had a show to do. And what a show! The Women song and the Quintron song killed the show for me. Quintron always comes through, but i picked an old one and it just did not work. Awesome King Khan song and that Louvin brothers tune with the speech in it is amazing. Lots of other good stuff as well. Take care. chris
item.itunes:subtitle: Rock Trivia 2

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Jun-2008
item.description: thanks to BLEEK for liking the Mister Magic song it is a classic also on the program is a great They Shoot Horses cover my friend Trevor made. Some good tunes. A little tight though. Hope to be better next time.
item.itunes:subtitle: it's getting tough

item.description: sleeping in my comfy bed right now. Music Waste was wonderful. Sorry the show is a mess. Next week will be without a doubt the greatest show of my life./ chris

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Jun-2008
item.description: Music Waste happens this June 4th to the 8th, so the first hour had me trying to explain that to you. Lots of good bands. If I may, might I suggest you see Hank And Lily, Ora Cogan, Mattress, Stamina Mantis and Flowers from the Man that shot your cousin, if not just for the name. The first hour was dedicated to the upcoming week of mischeif and wonder. chris

item.title: choices!!
item.description: My friend Lauren showed me Snoop Dogg's new video. It's pretty awesome. On Today's show we honour the 29 years of Miss Alison Audrey Therri-iffic with Run DMC Dolly PArton Gmarls Barkley Women with Kitchen Appliances Chad Allen and Old Manic Street Preachers. Enjoy!

item.title: Broadcast on 17-Mar-2008
item.description: I am liking the Vancouver scene. I am hearing about a whole bunch of acts again and they are great. Search Parties, Terrorbird, Lala, A relative Distance, Kellarissa, No gold, Nu Sensae, The Defecktors, are only a few of them. Keep em coming I will try to play them all. chris

item.description: hey cha cha cha love chris
item.itunes:subtitle: energy energy

item.title: You tone deaf kids!!
item.description: so I, through the years, have played alot of kids bands. I believe it stems from being a piano teacher, and finding great joy in the fact that some kids just get it. The first hour is a collection of kids from a whole bunch of time periods making sloppy out of tune wonderful delightful music. The same riff raff in the last hour. hope you enjoy.

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Feb-2008
item.description: a couple of weeks of not podding. the first week was not here the second week the show was a disaster except a Rafter song that I will get to next week (the horns are awesome) this one I enjoyed good flow new No Kids (listen to Duncan's Donuts this week or the podcast. I bet myself 1500 bucks that his first song was going to be a no kids song. There are some good albums coming out so next week I am looking forward to. I will be giving lots of tickets out so tune in. chris

item.title: Broadcast on 28-Jan-2008
item.description: So I began with track one from the Black Mountain album. I am kind of torn. There are too many venues again. You know what that means? There will be too few venues again in six months. EVERYONE!!! To my HOME. For Rockin'!!!! I will give you the directions. It will be called Chez Riffic and Sealed With a Kiss will bow to my venue!!! But I digress...............
item.itunes:subtitle: new Black Mountain...what an original cat I am!

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Jan-2008
item.description: Saw the Black rider and it was great! Luke played me runnin with the devil with just David Lee roth's vocals I couldn't play it for you. You really missed out. Listen to Luke Meat's show on Wednesday at 11:30am. going to see dan deacon and already I am tired. see you next week.
item.itunes:subtitle: black rider..............tres bien!

item.title: Broadcast on 07-Jan-2008
item.description: so....................things are great. I hope they are for you. We Citr DJ"s are treading water until Luke gives us more stuff to play. I got some new Twin Crystals. It is the new project from Jesse of Channels 3 and 4. Wonderful talent and nice gent. chris
item.itunes:subtitle: my girlfriend is so fucking rad!

item.title: Broadcast on 31-Dec-2007
item.description: Happy new year and all that. I got some great gifts and played them on the show. Went a little too much on the AC/DC and got the 10th degree from the immortal Nimrod. Sam the Sham.....rock's forgotten genius. chris
item.itunes:subtitle: and what a merry Christmas it was!

hey!
thanks to my girlfriend Alison and my friend David for co-hosting the show. Sorry to Leo Ramirez and the good people of El Salvador for cutting into his show. see you next year.
chris

item.description: saw Daniel Johnston doc and loved it got a message from my friend Merek and played his band I really like it Played a good mix good hustle played a song for some friends who seem to know more about music than I ever will hope you enjoy.

item.title: Broadcast on 29-Oct-2007
item.description: I didn't play any BA Johnston, but I recently had conversation with him that I am thinking of right now. He was telling me that he has been with his girlfriend for, like five years. On one hand, I am happy for him. She must be a great lady. But On the other hand, all his songs are about how much of a loser he is and how he cant find a girlfriend. I feel so deceived. My friend Pietro has this on line Magazine complete with CD compilation called Spoox which stresses odd musicians and found sounds. I played alot off his album on this show. Happy Halloween.
item.itunes:subtitle: Spoox

item.title: Broadcast on 22-Oct-2007
item.description: a little bit of everything hope you enjoy should just get friends to make CD's for me makes life easy thanks ROBBBBBBBBB chris

item.description: I watched Rushmore for the first time. That Creation song is awesome and I played it first and then I played a whole bunch of other songs. Not a bad show. Not my best though.
